page.title: 01GENERAL INFORMATION
page.content: The area embraces three distinct districts, the part of Great Witley with the Parish Church and historic Witley Court, the central area of Hillhampton and Sankyns Green and part of the village of Shrawley. The Parish Church and Witley Court attract thousands of visitors each year both for sight-seeing and to attend musical functions. The central area is completely given over to farming which is mainly arable. The main road area of Shrawley is more residential with two public houses and the Post Office and Village Stores. There is a thriving village community here as you will see from the activities listed on page 16. The Glasshampton Monastery is on the border near Astley. The main A443 road from Tenbury to Worcester passes through the block.
